channel.title: How to get a server public
channel.description: ive dled noi-p and everything but i told my firend my ip and i can login to it but he cant can somone help me

item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

[quote=“mandood77, post:13, topic:302032”][quote author=I Yaa I link=topic=398366.msg2956966#msg2956966 date=1252885950]

You’re an idiot. My client doesn’t have a gui.java, and i bet you it’s 200x better than yours.
[/quote] are you talking to me?

Who else am i talking to?
[/quote] off topic…[/quote]

Idiot.
[/quote] are you talking to me?

That’s off topic, stop trying to act like you are all big and tough… This just proves that you are more of an idiot than before.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a server public
item.dc:creator: @mandood77 mandood77
item.description:
@mandood77 wrote:

[quote=“I Yaa I, post:8, topic:302032”][quote author=Rrie link=topic=398366.msg2956084#msg2956084 date=1252843361]
I had same problem with this too…

1.)Go into your clients client.java NOT THE SERVERS CLIENT.JAVA

2.)Press Ctrl+F at the same time, hold them.

3.)It brings up a search bar. Put in “no-ip” <— Without the comma’s. Press Search.

4.)There should be 2 no-ip things in there, but search more just in case. Change both of them, and both of them ONLY to your no-ip thing. With your no-ip DUC it says your server name. Put that in.

5.)Also, go into GUI.java. And search for 127.0.0.1

6.)Change that to your server IP.

7.)Upload ALL OF THE CLIENT FILES IN 1 FOLDER TO A SITE. Mediafire.com for example…

8.)Make sure you have no-ip DUC running and the servers run.bat or whatever it’s name is at the same time and then people can connect.

If someone thinks this is wrong and if it is then please correct me. But for the most part that’s what I did to get a server running on my bros computer.
[/quote]

First of all, you do not search no-ip. You search setserver.
And Secondly, not all clients have a gui.java.[/quote] If your client don’t have Gui.java, than try another client

Read full topic
item.source: How to get a server public

item.title: How to get a server public
item.dc:creator: @I_Yaa_I I Yaa I
item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

[quote=“Rrie, post:3, topic:302032”]I had same problem with this too…

1.)Go into your clients client.java NOT THE SERVERS CLIENT.JAVA

2.)Press Ctrl+F at the same time, hold them.

3.)It brings up a search bar. Put in “no-ip” <— Without the comma’s. Press Search.

4.)There should be 2 no-ip things in there, but search more just in case. Change both of them, and both of them ONLY to your no-ip thing. With your no-ip DUC it says your server name. Put that in.

5.)Also, go into GUI.java. And search for 127.0.0.1

6.)Change that to your server IP.

7.)Upload ALL OF THE CLIENT FILES IN 1 FOLDER TO A SITE. Mediafire.com for example…

8.)Make sure you have no-ip DUC running and the servers run.bat or whatever it’s name is at the same time and then people can connect.

If someone thinks this is wrong and if it is then please correct me. But for the most part that’s what I did to get a server running on my bros computer.[/quote]

First of all, you do not search no-ip. You search setserver.
And Secondly, not all clients have a gui.java.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a server public
item.dc:creator: @toxic72 toxic72
item.description:
@toxic72 wrote:

ok i will help first add a host in no-ip then open up control pannel and goto network connections right click on the connection and click on properties. goto advanced tad and click on the only button. click add port and type 43593 for port and anything for the title then click ok your done

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a server public
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

WoodcutGuy:

If you don’t have a router, you CANNOT host a server, unless you use uTorrent which has virus all over it.

You CAN host a server without a router… It’s actually easier to do so without one. :\

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a server public
item.dc:creator: @Rrie Rrie
item.description:
@Rrie wrote:

I had same problem with this too…

1.)Go into your clients client.java NOT THE SERVERS CLIENT.JAVA

2.)Press Ctrl+F at the same time, hold them.

3.)It brings up a search bar. Put in “no-ip” <— Without the comma’s. Press Search.

4.)There should be 2 no-ip things in there, but search more just in case. Change both of them, and both of them ONLY to your no-ip thing. With your no-ip DUC it says your server name. Put that in.

5.)Also, go into GUI.java. And search for 127.0.0.1

6.)Change that to your server IP.

7.)Upload ALL OF THE CLIENT FILES IN 1 FOLDER TO A SITE. Mediafire.com for example…

8.)Make sure you have no-ip DUC running and the servers run.bat or whatever it’s name is at the same time and then people can connect.

If someone thinks this is wrong and if it is then please correct me. But for the most part that’s what I did to get a server running on my bros computer.

Read full topic
